articles.title: New research shows South Africa’s levy on sugar-sweetened drinks is having an impact - News24
articles.description: We found that the health promotion levy coincided with large reductions in purchases of taxable beverages, in terms of both volume and sugar quantities.
articles.content:
Three years ago South Africa introduced Africa’s first major tax on sugar-sweetened beverages based on grams of sugar. The tax now stands at about 11% of the price per litre.
